WorkItem.Description:
If the rotation is changed such that the change will result in a change in DPS, the Overall DPS listed will not update unless an item/enchant/buff is changed.
Â 
This may or may not also be the cause of the optimizer suggesting I break t7 4pc for a decrease in overall dps.
WorkItem.Summary: [DPSDK] Rotation Changes Not Updating Overall DPS

Comments.Message: Changes made to rotation do not appear to be taken into account until the rotation window is closed.  However, in all of my testing, the numbers are always recalculated after the rotation window is closed.

So the real issue would be loss of RP from T7.5 isn't accounted for until rotation window is entered and rotation changed, which would lead to the discrepancy in Rawr thinking losing T7.5 bonus for a better single piece of gear is a good choice?

Actually, yes.  I didn't even think about that until you mentioned it.

Forcing automated RP management would possibly fix this (the difference between 4pc T7 and not is some number of Death Coils or Frost Strikes per rotation, right?).

Using my above attached file, using RP Management does result in the DPS change when set bonus is broken/gain. If the optimizer is run, it still breaks the set bonus for a loss in overall DPS, but a gain in DPS before the RP Management is factored in. So potentially a fault of the optimizer.
